Description: A segmented pottery dish made from uncoated red silt clay. The fabric contained chaff, which has burned out to leave voids. There is a single circular inner compartment with two flanking outer compartments of semicircular form. The outer compartments are separated only by thin partitions. Parts of the exterior wall of the outer compartment, that is, the side of the whole vessel, have been broken away.
Curator's comments: Very similar piece published from Naukratis, dated 7th to 5th century BC (Hogarth et. al. 1905, 125, fig. 5).

Parallels: Cf. Defernez, C., La céramique d’époque perse à Tell el-Herr: étude chrono-typologique et comparative, CRIPEL Suppl. 5, vol. 2, Lille, 2003, pl. 2, no. 6 and vol.1, (2001), 52; Aston, D.A., 1990, ‘Stadt und Tempel von Elephantine 17/18 Grabungsbericht: Keramikkomplex 17805A’, MDAIK 46, (1990), 234, no. 17805A, 11, fig. 13.
Similar, from Naukratis, British Museum 1888,0601.1546 and 1909,1201.22, possibly the same piece as illustrated by Hogarth.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IB.022)
